title.narrative: ASEAN Community Integration

description.narrative: Support projects in Southeast Asia to be implemented by the USAID Regional Development Mission for Asia (RDMA) in collaboration with the ASEAN Secretariat and ASEAN Committee of Permanent Representatives in Jakarta, and relevant ASEAN sectoral bodies, in coordination with the United States Mission to ASEAN. Support the creation of a more integrated "ASEAN Community" by 2015. Activities reach across all three "pillars" of ASEAN integration: Political-Security, Economic, and Socio-Cultural, and have realized significant gains in several sectors, including economic integration, disaster management, human rights, and pandemic preparedness.

title.narrative: ASEAN Studies Center Good Governance Grants

description.narrative: One small grants to the ASEAN Studies Center (ASC) at American University was sissued to provide assistance to ASEAN country participants, particularly subject matter experts from civil society, to build skills for participation in regional discussions in their areas of expertise. Topics of these discussions may include: ASEAN integration; steps needed to achieve an ASEAN Economic Community by 2015; transnational crime; water management; climate change; human rights and economic development. This trainings focused on building capacity of ASEAN Member nation participants in civil society and governance.hese events clarify issues of priority concern to ASEAN countries and the United States, while giving ASEAN experts the opportunity to engage with leading U.S. experts.

title.narrative: Contract: Seafarers - Expanded ASEAN Seafarers Training (EAST)

description.narrative: EAST is as a forum for civilian mariners and the civilian seafaring community to share information and recommendations that will ultimately save lives and reduce loss to pirate attacks around the world. Subject matter experts from maritime training academies, active civilian mariners, and merchant marine cadets will conduct sessions on best practices based on lessons learned from actual pirate attacks and analysis of evolving pirate techniques. Civilian mariners who have been victims of pirate attacks will also give first-hand accounts of their experiences.

title.narrative: ASEAN Country Participants Assistance

description.narrative: Two small grants to the ASEAN Studies Center (ASC) at American University to provide assistance to ASEAN country participants, particularly subject matter experts from civil society, to build skills for participation in regional discussions in their areas of expertise. Topics of these discussions may include: ASEAN integration; steps needed to achieve an ASEAN Economic Community by 2015; transnational crime; water management; climate change; human rights and economic development. In prior years, participants from ASEAN countries have presented their analysis, gained exposure to U.S. and international technical experts, and developed sets of recommendations for ASEAN and U.S. Leaders. These trainings will build capacity of ASEAN Member nation participants in civil society and governance.hese events clarify issues of priority concern to ASEAN countries and the United States, while giving ASEAN experts the opportunity to engage with leading U.S. experts.

title.narrative: Travel Support for Trainers -- Seafarers - Expanded ASEAN Seafarers Training (EAST)

description.narrative: EAST is as a forum for civilian mariners and the civilian seafaring community to share information and recommendations that will ultimately save lives and reduce loss to pirate attacks around the world. Subject matter experts from maritime training academies, active civilian mariners, and merchant marine cadets will conduct sessions on best practices based on lessons learned from actual pirate attacks and analysis of evolving pirate techniques. Civilian mariners who have been victims of pirate attacks will also give first-hand accounts of their experiences.

title.narrative: ARF - EEP Grant (Pac Forum-CSIS)

description.narrative: .This award is for thge Center Strategic for and International Studies/CSCAP to represent the United States at, and help manage/run, a series of info-sharing and policy workshop events on non-proliferation, maritime security, emergency disaster response and preparedness, and preventive diplomacy for the ASEAN Regional Forum (ARF) throughout the calendar year 2013. .The ASEAN Regional Forum (ARF) is a grouping of 26 nations, plus the European Union, focused on regional security, preventive diplomacy, and activities in the priority areas of disaster preparedness and response, nonproliferation and disarmament, counter-terrorism and transnational crime, cyber security, and maritime security, which also includes environmental activities. One of the goals here is also to develop closer cooperation and information sharing among ASEAN Regional Forum member states to advance the ARF regional cooperation agenda. .
